name: Saxton's Map of Lancashire (1577)
description: Christopher Saxton's county map of Lancashire â€” part of the first atlas of England and Wales (1579). Engraved by Remigius Hogenberg. Shows Manchester as a small market town.
notes:
Part of Saxton's Atlas of England and Wales (1579), first complete county atlas.
Patronised by Thomas Seckford. Engraved by Remigius Hogenberg.
Lord Burghley's copy: BL Royal MS 18 D III, ff.15v-16 (Lancashire).
Burghley annotated it with locations of Catholic families.
Chetham's Library also holds a copy: https://library.chethams.com/collections/101-treasures-of-chethams/saxtons-atlas-of-england-and-wales/
Wikimedia Commons has images from Burghley's Atlas.
